story.kicker_image_caption: Italian artist AleXsandro Palombo has created a series of pictures called Survivor. Picture courtesy: AleXsandro Palombo
story.storykicker: An Italian artist has re-imagined Disney princesses--Jasmine, Snow White, Cinderella and others--as breast-cancer survivors, ahead of Cancer Survivor's Day (June 5).
story.storybody:
"Every woman is beautiful, even after a mastectomy, and women should know that."

--AleXsandro Palombo

For the past few years, Disney princesses have been re-imagined in many avatars--from bad*ss pin-up models to modern women.

This time, however, an Italian artist--AleXsandro Palombo--has recreated not only Disney princesses, but other characters like Betty Boop, Wonder Woman and Marge Simpson, as breast-cancer survivors, who are showing off their scars proudly.

Also read: The Disney musical, Beauty and the Beast, is an absolute treat to the eyes

These 13 ladies pose in defiance while flashing the 'V for victory' sign. Palombo named this series of pictures Survivor.

Through this series, Palombo hopes to raise awareness about breast cancer, he told Cosmopolitan UK, "I intended this series to be a powerful reflection on the disease, mastectomy and its effects, female identity and acceptance."

These powerful images have been released by the artist ahead of Cancer Survivor's Day, June 5, to raise awareness about the potentially fatal disease and also support those who have survived.

Also read: Video of an autistic boy falling in love with Snow White at Disney World will make you emotional

The pictures also highlight the importance of early diagnosis, as recent figures shows that the number of women getting tested for breast cancer has doubled in the past few years.

Wonder Woman

{mosimage}

Olive from Popeye

{mosimage}

Ariel from The Little Mermaid

{mosimage}

Marge Simpson

{mosimage}

Lois Griffin

{mosimage}

{mosimage}

Cinderella

{mosimage}

Betty Boop

{mosimage}

Jessica Rabbit

{mosimage}


Check out the full list here.
